description.p: Eldritch Champion power comes from a pact you’ve made with an otherwordly powerful warrior. It might be from a powerful Knights of the Past, or your power comes from a powerful Demon General from The Abyss or Nine Hells, or you gain your power through a deal with a powerful celestial that need a champion to do some biddings. As their champion, you’re bestowed with a power that will help you carry on your task and bidding for that being. When you gain the power of an Eldritch Champion, you’re granted with a martial prowess that’ll aid you in a battle comes, along with the power to help you strike down your foes, or protect you from upcoming harm, the power that ensure you will finish your task for your patron.
The Eldritch Champion lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

The influence of your patron also allows you to mystically channel your will through a particular weapon. At 1st level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one melee weapon, that weapon become your Soulbond Weapon until you choose a new weapon at the end of another long rest. You become proficient with that weapon. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls. If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, this benefit extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature.

description.p: Your patron blesses and enhances your physical body with skill necessary to carry out its task. At 1st level, your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

You become proficient with both Strenngth (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) skill if you haven’t already. Whenever you’re subjected with those checks, you can use your Charisma modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for those checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain any expended uses when you finish a short rest or long rest.

sheet.description: When you make an Athletics or Acrobatics check, you use your Charisma modifier instead of Strenght or Dexterity.

description.p: Your patron’s power allows you to extend your bond with any armor and shield you deemed suitable to help you on your goals. Starting at 6th level, you can transform one armor and/or one shield into your pact armor by performing a special ritual while you hold the armor and/or shield. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the armor and the shield, shunting it into an extradimensional space. You can instantly don or dismiss the armor and/or the shield using your action. Both of them ceases being your pact armor if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different armor or shield, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The armor and/or the shield appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

You become proficient with your pact armor and/or shield. You can use the shield as your warlock spellcasting focus and you can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapon and your shield from your Pact Armor in both hands. You can substitute and use your Charisma instead of Strength for the prerequisite of your pact armor if it have any. If you take Pact of the Blade option, you can manifest or dismiss both of your pact weapon and pact armor at a same time as part of same action.

description.p: You have power to create a magical barrier which protects you from harm. Starting at 10th level, whenever a creature attempt to hits you with an attack or force you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant bonus to your AC or saving throw (your choice) equals to your Charisma modifier. The bonus will last until the start of your next turn.
After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or a long rest, or after you cast a spell using your warlock spellslot.

sheet.description: Whenever a creature attempt to hits you with an attack or force you to make a saving throw, you can grant a +{{charisma:modifier}} bonus to your AC or saving throw. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest, or after you cast a spell using your warlock spellslot.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use your bonus action to tap into the great power of your patron, greatly enhancing both your martial prowess and magical power, and enhance your ability to combine both of them. For 1 minute, or until you’re incapacitated you will gain this benefit:

ol.li: Your weapon attack or warlock spell attack deals an additional 1d8 force damage to the target on hit.
If you use your action to cast a spell or a cantrip, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls.

description.p: After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. You also regain the use of this feature after you cast spell from your Mystic Arcanum Spell.

If you have Umbral Wolf as your familiar, it gains additional hit points equal to twice of your warlock level. When your Umbral Wolf is in an area of dim light or darkness, it can use its action to become invisible. It remain invisible until it makes an attack, or are in an area of bright light.
